intro: Duckeella linearilabia, commonly known as the linear-labied duckeella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
